alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 7:19PM CDT until March 31 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT FOR EASTERN LAFAYETTE...GREEN...EASTERN IOWA...ROCK...DANE AND SOUTHWESTERN JEFFERSON COUNTIES... At 718 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mount Horeb to near Albany to Davis, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Madison, Janesville, Beloit, Fitchburg, Middleton, Stoughton, Fort Atkinson, Monroe, Verona, Oregon, Jefferson, McFarland, Monona, Mount Horeb, Lake Mills, Milton, Edgerton, Evansville, Brodhead, and Cottage Grove. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central and southeastern Wisconsin. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
